metadata.title: CVE-2022-42720 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.description:
Various refcounting bugs in the multi-BSS handling in the mac80211 stack inthe Linux kernel 5.1 through 5.19.x before 5.19.16 could be used by localattackers (able to inject WLAN frames) to trigger use-after-free conditionsto potentially execute code.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-42720` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.19.0-21-generic - 5.19.0-23.24
linux-image-5.19.0-21-generic-lpae - 5.19.0-23.24
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-21-generic - 5.19.0-23.24
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-21-generic-64k - 5.19.0-23.24
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1010-azure - 5.19.0-1010.11
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.19.0-23.24').
linux-kvm package in lunar is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication.
linux-aws package in lunar is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication.
linux-azure package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.19.0-1010.11').
linux-gcp package in lunar is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication.
linux-ibm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of kernel support, was pending').
linux-lowlatency package in lunar is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication.
linux-oracle package in lunar is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication.
linux-raspi package in lunar is affected and needs fixing.
backport-iwlwifi-dkms package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
